1:
Yahweh, God of my salvation,
\q I cry out day and night before you.
\q
2:
Listen to my prayer;
\q pay attention to my cry.
3:
For I am filled with troubles,
\q and my life has reached Sheol.
\q
4:
People treat me like those who go down into the pit;
\q I am a man with no strength.
5:
I am abandoned among the dead;
\q I am like the dead who lie in the grave,
\q about whom you care no more
\q because they are cut off from your power.
\q
6:
You place me in the lowest part of the pit,
\q in the dark and deep places.
7:
Your wrath lies heavy on me,
\q and all your waves crash over me.
\qs Selah\qs*
8:
Because of you, my acquaintances avoid me.
\q You have made me a shocking sight to them.
\q I am hemmed in and I cannot escape.
10:
Will you do wonders for the dead?
\q Will those who have died rise and praise you?
\qs Selah\qs*
11:
Will your covenant faithfulness be proclaimed in the grave,
\q your loyalty in the place of the dead?
\q
12:
Will your wonderful deeds be known in the darkness,
\q or your righteousness in the place of forgetfulness?
14:
Yahweh, why do you reject me?
\q Why do you hide your face from me?
15:
I have always been afflicted and on the verge of death since my youth.
\q I have suffered from your terrors; I am in despair.
\q
16:
Your angry actions have passed over me,
\q and your terrifying deeds have annihilated me.
18:
You have removed every friend and acquaintance from me.
\q My only acquaintance is the darkness.
88:
\m
\d A song, a psalm of the sons of Korah; for the chief musician; set to the Mahalath Leannoth style. A maschil of Heman the Ezrahite.
\q
